translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 185:2 The line of teachers and pupils by whom the Yâ g ñ avalkya-kâ n d a p. 186 was handed down. From 1-10 the Va m s a agrees with the Va m s a at the end of II, 6.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Brihadâranyaka Upan... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: The Mâdhyandina text begins with vayam, we, and proceeds to 1. Saurpa n âyya, 2. Gautama, 3. Vâtsya, 4. Pâra s arya, &c., as in the Madhukâ n d a, p. 118, except in 10, where it gives G aivantâyana for Âtreya. Then after 12. Kau n d inyâyana, it gives 13. 14. the two Kau n d inyas, 15. the Aur n avâbhas, 16. Kau n d inya, 17. Kau n d inya, 18. Kau n d inya and Âgnivesya, 19. Saitava, 20. Pârâ s arya, 2 1. G âtukar n ya, 22. Bhâradvâ g a, 2 3. Bhâradvâ g a, Âsurâya n a, and Gautama, 24. Bhâradvâ g a, 25. Valâkâkau s ika, 26. Kâshâya n a, 27. Saukarâya n a, 28. Traiva n i, 29. Aupa g andhani, 30. Sâyakâyana, p. Kau s ikâyani, &c., as in the Kâ n va text, from No. 22 to Brahman.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Brihadâranyaka Upan... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 186:1 From here the Va m s a agrees again with that given at the end of II, 6.
